reviewText:
I really liked Wolfenstein. Don't expect clever game mechanics, or an engaging story. This is just shooting nazi's. Lots of them. With lasers. The AI is capable, but that's about it. The game is diverse enough, but it can become a drag at some stages.

The worst part is the story, and the presentation of the story. My god, BJ Blazskowizc spends the entire game whispering like he thinks he is Max Payne or something. His love interest (does he need one? No, our hero should only need nazi's which he can kill in a variaty of ways) is very irritating.

But overall this is a nice game.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
While I haven't played the original series, as a history buff I found it hard not to love this game as soon as I saw the trailers. I pre-ordered the game the moment it came available on steam and can proudly say that I've never had a problem or issue with the game. If one is nit-picky then you'll naturally find the issues as with any game. In short, if you want a fun shoot'em up style of game where the horrors of war follows you everywhere you go the story keeps you hooked the entire time and it only gets better from there. My only wish is the same with other games that are the same price is that I wish there was more that I got with it. Theres so much potential here story-wise for future games and I can't wait to pre-order the next one in the series.

Rating 9/10: Minor Spoiler: There are a few minor plot wholes that need fixing but at that moment in the story there's so much going on that you hardly even notice them as the plot wholes are close to the climax. Maybe I'm wrong and I've just missed them being explained in the dialogue but after I played through it a couple times I looked back and couldn't help wonder how a few things happened the way they did. :End Minor Spoiler:
I give it a 9 out of ten because there are minor things that need fixing, and tweaks to be made, minor adjustments really, but overall I felt that the campaign was....well quick to be honest and when it was over I couldn't help but say that its ending could've been better played out regardless of how its supposed" to happen plot wise. In short

recommended: definutely not for a minor(as in a child)

and you go into all-out take cover and hold the trigger down mode. Once the you kill the enemies and the alarm goes off things go back to pretending to be stealthy again because apparentlly they didn't bother to phone anyone else.

The perk system is a set of challenges and while there is somewhat of a tree (a few perks require a previous perk) most everything is up for grabs so you don't have to choose one perk tree to focus on.

reviewText:
It's one of the prettiest games to date. For gameplay, a shooter is a shooter is a shooter, though it seems to be very stringy with ammo at times while being exceedingly liberal with it at others. The stealth elements are not as well developed as in, say, DXHR, but they do work.

The contrast between how seriously it appears to take it's own story and how it can't possibly be serious about it is quite puzzling, though, and I am not sure if this is a positive or a negative. But for me, I'd say this contrast itself is the high point of the game.

Get it anyway.

reviewText: 10/10 - Like Skyrim with Nazis\n\nMemes, aside, this game is just fun. Graphics aren't the prettiest, but that's the point. reviewText:
I thought the original reboot was kind of fun, especially with the classic pokey knife being used again. looking forward to the next title.

voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I bought this game on its premise that the Nazis won World War II. The retro futuristic aspect of the game added to my enjoyment. And no hint of multiplayer made this come to the top of my list. The game is challenging at times but it was not enough to drive me away from finishing the game in a long weekend marathon gaming session.

The game writer did well. I was not expecting the amount of character development  that Blazkowicz undergoes. You feel his pain and sorrow about what he has done and witnessed; his hopes for the future. Over the course of my twelve hour pay through I slow found myself becoming emotionally drawn into Blazkowicz's story and why he was fighting against the tyranny of the Nazis. The mucsical score was another unexpected great joy. Unlike most other games that just have music to have it, here the music adds to the overall feel of teh game and fits the mind set of Blazkowicz at the current moment in time.

Having an American protagonist but not going to Nazi occupied United States was a small disappointment but going to the moon made up for that. Nazi moon base for the win.
